resources.string: Hey, wanderer! You must be that hacker I’ve been hearing so much about… Doesn’t matter. Nobody can do it. Many have tried… What’s your name? Who knows, maybe when you lose I can use it as my password. And remember once you say it there is no way back!

Well, Name, let’s get this over with. The rules of the game are quite simple: you will be given a password — a singular noun consisting of 4, 5 or 6 letters depending on the difficulty you chose. You are going to have to use all of your vocabulary to crack the password by sequentially entering words consisting of the same number of letters the password does. If an entered word contains a letter that appears in the password, one of two things can happen: the letter will turn green if its position in the entered word matches its position in the password and yellow if it doesn’t. Each entered word must actually exist. You’re allowed 6 guesses. It may take you less than 6 but I really doubt that… For each cracked password I’ll give you one trophy: bronze – for a 4-letter password, silver – for a 5-letter and finally gold – for a 6-letter.

I’ll even give you a head start. Here are some tips you can feel free to use: 
 The game is tactical. There is absolutely no need to guess the password right away. Try opening some letters and their positions first. 
 Even though my passwords are the strongest and the hardest to crack they’re still words which means commonly used letters are welcome. But I didn’t tell you that!.. cough-cough… 
 If you already know the position of a certain letter and have a few guesses left, it wouldn’t be a bad idea to enter the words in which the letter isn’t in this particular position. But it only works if you have more than one guess left, otherwise go all in and use your last guess with surgical precision! 
 Good luck, Name. Trust me you are going to need it…
